WhyChooseUs.p1: we are a Puerto Rican company established in 2020 as a result of the COVID pandemic.
WhyChooseUs.p2: Our medical group is composed of a diverse number of assistant doctors, nurses, internists, and specialists. Our goal is to bring Health to the greatest number of people in Puerto Rico from our center to the comfort of your home.

HowItWorks.title: How it works?
HowItWorks.subtitle: Follow these steps to get the desired prescription
HowItWorks.step1: Complete the registration, choose the desired medical or laboratory service.
HowItWorks.step2: Pay with Credit Card or ATH MOVIL.

HowItWorks.step4: If it is a medical appointment, a doctor will contact you during the day. If you need a faster appointment, please call us at our number (787) 710-7426.

certificado-mdico-26.title: Medical Certificate
certificado-mdico-26.description: Full clinical evaluation service and medical certification required to justify work absences to your employer or institution.
certificado-mdico-26.detail:
Medical Evaluation and Digital Work Certification

Our service consists of a remote professional medical evaluation, performed by an authorized physician, with the goal of:

  • Establishing a reliable clinical diagnosis.

  • Defining the recommended course of treatment.

  • Estimating the number of rest or incapacity days needed for full recovery before returning to work.

Once the evaluation is complete, you will receive a digital medical certificate that:

  • Contains all the necessary medical supporting information.

  • Will be sent directly to your email address.

  • Can be presented to your employer or institution to justify absences and access sick-day pay.

This certificate meets all current legal and health standards, and is designed to streamline the work-absence justification process, without requiring you to travel physically.

examen-licencia-conducir-27.title: Driver's License Exam
examen-licencia-conducir-27.description: Professional medical evaluation required for the application or renewal of a driver's license.

programa-de-salud-sexual-para-hombres-37.title: Men's Sexual Health Program
programa-de-salud-sexual-para-hombres-37.description: Private medical consultation for erectile dysfunction. Includes evaluation, diagnosis, prescription treatment (Viagra or Cialis), and health recommendations.
programa-de-salud-sexual-para-hombres-37.detail:
If you are experiencing difficulty maintaining an erection, have noticed a decrease in your sexual performance, or simply feel that something has changed in your intimate life, you are not alone.
Erectile dysfunction is more common than it seems and affects men of all ages for various reasons ‚Äî from physical and hormonal factors to emotional or lifestyle-related causes.

This specialized medical service is designed to provide you with comprehensive, professional, and completely confidential care.
Through a personalized medical evaluation, we seek to identify the possible causes of the dysfunction and help you regain your sexual well-being safely and confidently.

What does this consultation include?

  • Complete medical evaluation focused on erectile dysfunction symptoms

  • Detailed review of your medical history, habits, and risk factors

  • Clear clinical diagnosis based on up-to-date medical criteria

  • Effective treatment prescription: Viagra (sildenafil) or Cialis (tadalafil), if appropriate for your case

  • Personalized recommendations to improve your sexual health short and long term

  • Care that is confidential, respectful, and judgment-free

This service not only aims to treat symptoms, but also to help you understand what is affecting your sexual function.
Regaining your confidence and quality of intimate life is possible with the support of medical professionals.

back-to-school-39.title: ‚ÄúBack to School‚Äù
back-to-school-39.description: Quick pediatric consultation for returning to school after vacations or illness. Includes general health check and same-day certificate delivery.
back-to-school-39.detail:
Does your child need a medical certificate to return to school?
We know these procedures can be urgent and sometimes stressful.
That is why we offer a quick, professional pediatric consultation focused on providing a safe, hassle-free solution with reliable medical support.

This service is designed to meet school and institutional requirements, ensuring your child is in optimal health to return to classes or activities.

What does this consultation include?

  • General medical review: evaluation of vital signs, weight, height, and overall health

  • Clinical assessment to determine if the child is fit to return to school activities

  • Issuance of an official and valid medical certificate, signed by an authorized professional

When is it useful?

  • For return to school after vacations, extended breaks, or absences

  • As medical clearance after common illnesses such as flu, COVID-19, chickenpox, etc.

  • To fulfill school or institutional requirements that require a medical evaluation

This service is designed to be agile, clear, and effective, allowing you to meet your school obligations without delays and with the support of a medical team committed to children's health.

cita-de-seguimiento-31.title: Follow-up Appointment
cita-de-seguimiento-31.description: Follow-up medical consultation to monitor the progress of existing treatments or conditions.

cita-medica-nuevo-paciente-30.title: New Patient Medical Appointment
cita-medica-nuevo-paciente-30.description: Comprehensive initial medical evaluation (in-person or remote) for first-time visiting patients.

consulta-por-covid-positivo-33.title: COVID Positive Consultation
consulta-por-covid-positivo-33.description: Personalized home-based medical evaluation for positive patients. Includes prescription, care plan, and certificate if needed.
consulta-por-covid-positivo-33.detail:
The COVID Positive Consultation is a comprehensive medical evaluation directed at patients who have received a confirmed diagnosis of infection by the SARS-CoV-2 virus (COVID-19). The main purpose of this consultation is to monitor the patient's clinical status, identify acute complications or post-infection sequelae, and establish an appropriate follow-up plan based on the disease progression.

During the consultation, a detailed clinical history is taken, including the onset date of symptoms, their duration, type and severity, as well as personal medical background that may influence the clinical course of COVID-19 (such as chronic respiratory or cardiovascular diseases, immunosuppression, among others). The physical examination focuses on the respiratory, cardiovascular, and neurological systems, with special attention to signs of hypoxia, persistent fatigue, dyspnea, or neurosensory alterations.

Depending on the patient's current status, complementary tests may be indicated, such as chest X-ray or CT scan, pulmonary function tests, general lab work, or cardiological evaluation. Specific recommendations on isolation, home care, warning signs, and ‚Äî when necessary ‚Äî criteria for referral to a higher-complexity center are also provided.

This consultation also includes emotional and psychological support for the patient, given the social and mental impact that a COVID-19 diagnosis can entail, and guides on prevention measures for household members, as well as criteria for medical discharge or return to work.

evaluacin-mdica-del-sueo-36.title: Medical Sleep Evaluation
evaluacin-mdica-del-sueo-36.description: Professional evaluation to diagnose insomnia or sleep disorders. Includes diagnosis, recommendations, and prescription if required.
evaluacin-mdica-del-sueo-36.detail:
Are you having difficulty sleeping at night?
If you find it hard to fall asleep, wake up multiple times without apparent reason, or start the day feeling exhausted, you may be dealing with a sleep disorder, such as insomnia.
If left untreated, this condition can affect your daily performance, mood, and even your long-term health.

This medical consultation is focused on fully understanding your situation.
A professional will evaluate your sleep pattern, symptoms, personal history, and lifestyle.
Based on that evaluation, you will receive a personalized clinical diagnosis that will determine whether it is necessary to initiate pharmacological treatment to improve your rest.

In addition to the medical evaluation, you will receive clear guidance on how to modify habits that may be interfering with your sleep, recommendations to improve your sleep hygiene, and, if justified, a medical prescription with precise instructions to begin a treatment that helps you sleep more deeply and continuously.

This service includes:

  • Medical consultation focused on insomnia symptoms and causes

  • Review of your daily routine, clinical history, and environmental factors

  • Clear diagnosis on the type and severity of the sleep disorder

  • Prescription of insomnia medication (only if necessary)

  • Practical, personalized tips to improve your nightly rest

Sleeping well is not a luxury ‚Äî it is a necessity.
With this medical care you can take the first step to reclaim your nights and improve your overall well-being.

evaluacin-mdica-inmediata-38.title: Immediate Medical Evaluation
evaluacin-mdica-inmediata-38.description: Fast consultation for urgent diagnoses, prescriptions, or certificates delivered the same day. Ideal for mild symptoms.
evaluacin-mdica-inmediata-38.detail:
• Fast, reliable care without complications
    Do you need immediate medical attention without long waiting times?

    Our Immediate Medical Evaluation is designed to provide you with a professional diagnosis in minutes, ideal for administrative procedures, treatments, or health follow-ups.

    What does it include?

    • Quick review of vital signs and general status

    • Medical consultation focused on your specific need

    • Recommendations or medical prescription depending on the case

    • Results and certificates delivered the same day (printed or digital)

    When to use it?

    • You need an urgent medical certificate

    • You have mild symptoms and want a quick assessment

    • You are starting a treatment with IV fluids, injections, or vitamins

    • You require medical support for school or work-related procedures

receta-de-medicamentos-o-refill-25.title: Medication Prescription or ‚ÄúRefill‚Äù
receta-de-medicamentos-o-refill-25.description: Fast renewal of maintenance prescriptions or authorized new medical prescriptions.

anlisis-de-orina-y-cultivo-de-orina-10.title: Urinalysis and Urine Culture
anlisis-de-orina-y-cultivo-de-orina-10.description: Detection of urinary infections, kidney problems, or diabetes through complete analysis of urine appearance and content.
anlisis-de-orina-y-cultivo-de-orina-10.detail:
Urinalysis is a simple and very useful test that helps us evaluate your overall health status. It can detect possible urinary tract infections, kidney problems, presence of blood, proteins, or sugar in the urine, among other important indicators.

The urine culture, in turn, is performed when a urinary infection is suspected. This test identifies whether there are bacteria in the urine and determines the exact type, which helps us choose the most effective treatment.

Why is it important?

  • Detects urinary tract infections (UTI)
  • Evaluates kidney function
  • Helps diagnose metabolic diseases
  • Enables timely and personalized treatment

How is it done?

You only need to provide a urine sample. It is a quick, painless, and non-invasive test.

When is it recommended?

  • If you experience symptoms such as burning when urinating, frequent trips to the bathroom, abdominal pain, or fever
  • During routine medical checkups
  • For monitoring chronic diseases such as diabetes or hypertension

cbc-diff-lab-45.title: CBC + DIFF Lab
cbc-diff-lab-45.description: Complete Blood Count with Differential to measure red and white blood cells and platelets. Detects anemia and infections.
cbc-diff-lab-45.detail:
CBC + DIFF (Complete Blood Count with Differential)

This is a blood test that provides detailed information about your overall health by measuring the quantity and quality of the different types of cells in your blood. The test includes two parts:

1. CBC (Complete Blood Count)

Measures the levels of:

  • Red blood cells

  • White blood cells

  • Platelets

  • Hemoglobin

Helps detect conditions such as anemia, infections, or blood disorders.

2. DIFF (White Blood Cell Differential)

Analyzes in detail the different types of white blood cells in your blood:

  • Neutrophils

  • Lymphocytes

  • Monocytes

  • Eosinophils

  • Basophils

This allows identification of infections, allergies, or immune problems.

What is it used for?

  • Disease detection: infections, anemia, blood disorders, allergies, or immune system dysfunction.

  • Monitoring chronic conditions: such as autoimmune diseases, hematological, or inflammatory disorders.

  • General health evaluation: a basic test that gives a comprehensive view of your physical condition.

When is it recommended?

  • If you have symptoms like fatigue, paleness, fever, easy bleeding, or bruising.

  • If your doctor needs to assess your general health or follow up on a medical condition.

  • As part of a routine checkup or to confirm infections or clinical diagnoses.

How is it done?

The test requires a blood sample, generally taken from a vein in the arm.
It is a quick, safe procedure that requires no special preparation.

femenino-prueba-de-sangre-blood-test-cbc.title: Female Blood Test (CBC, CMP, Lipid Panel, HbA1c, Thyroid, Urinalysis)
femenino-prueba-de-sangre-blood-test-cbc.description: Comprehensive profile evaluating organ function, cholesterol, diabetes, thyroid, kidney health, and occult blood in stool.
femenino-prueba-de-sangre-blood-test-cbc.detail:
This comprehensive set of blood and urine tests is designed to provide a complete evaluation of a woman's general health, enabling early detection of metabolic, hormonal, renal, hepatic, cardiovascular, thyroid, and digestive abnormalities. It is especially useful in routine medical checkups, risk factor assessment, and chronic condition monitoring.

1. Complete Blood Count (CBC):
Evaluates the quantity and quality of the main blood components (red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets), helping diagnose anemia, infections, hematological disorders, and inflammatory conditions.

2. Comprehensive Metabolic Panel (CMP):
Includes tests measuring electrolytes, glucose, liver, and kidney function, providing key information about general metabolism, acid-base balance, and vital organ function.

3. Lipid Panel:
Measures total cholesterol, HDL, LDL, and triglyceride levels ‚Äî essential for cardiovascular risk assessment and dyslipidemia management.

4. Urine Microalbumin:
Detects small amounts of albumin in the urine, useful for early assessment of kidney damage, especially in patients with diabetes or hypertension.

5. Glycated Hemoglobin (HbA1c):
Reflects the average blood glucose levels over the past 2‚Äì3 months ‚Äî a critical parameter for the diagnosis and monitoring of diabetes mellitus.

6. Urinalysis (U/A):
Provides information on kidney status, urinary infections, dehydration, and the presence of glucose or proteins, among other urinary parameters.

7. Thyroid Tests (T3, T4, TSH):
Evaluate thyroid gland function, enabling diagnosis of hypothyroidism or hyperthyroidism ‚Äî common conditions in women associated with multiple clinical symptoms.

8. Occult Blood in Stool:
Detects microscopic blood in stool, which can be an early sign of polyps, ulcers, inflammatory bowel disease, or colorectal cancer.

This panel allows for comprehensive preventive and diagnostic evaluation, and can be adapted or expanded based on the patient's age, clinical history, and current symptoms. Its use is key in women's preventive medicine and is recommended as part of an annual general health checkup.

mamografia-29.title: Mammography
mamografia-29.description: Specialized breast X-ray for early detection of abnormalities, tumors, or microcalcifications.
mamografia-29.detail:
What is a Mammography?

A mammography is a medical diagnostic imaging procedure that uses low-dose X-rays to obtain detailed images of the inside of the breasts. Its main purpose is the early detection of breast diseases, particularly breast cancer, even before physical symptoms or clinical signs appear.

This examination can identify very small lesions, such as nodules, masses, or microcalcifications, which may indicate benign or malignant conditions. Detecting these changes early significantly improves the chances of effective treatment and full recovery.

Types of Mammography

There are two main types:

1. Screening or detection mammography

  • Performed in women who have no symptoms.
  • Recommended as a routine study from a certain age.
  • Its purpose is to identify suspicious changes at very early stages.

2. Diagnostic mammography

  • Performed when symptoms are present, such as lumps, pain, discharge, or skin changes on the breast.
  • Also indicated to examine in more detail abnormal findings detected on a routine mammogram.
  • Usually requires more images and closer attention to a specific area of breast tissue.

Why is mammography important?

  • Early detection of breast cancer, the most common cancer in women.
  • Enables less invasive interventions and more effective treatments.
  • Proven to reduce breast cancer mortality rates in women over 40.
  • One of the main tools for population screening, along with self-examination and clinical breast exam.

Who should have a mammography?

  • Women between 40 and 74 years old, every 1-2 years, as medically recommended.
  • Women with a family history of breast cancer may need to start earlier or have it more frequently.
  • Women who present suspicious breast symptoms, regardless of age.

How to prepare for a mammography?

  • Do not use deodorant, powder, or creams on the day of the exam, as they may appear as spots on the image.
  • Inform the technician if you have breast implants.
  • If possible, schedule the study one week after your menstrual period, when the breasts are less sensitive.

Does mammography hurt?

Mammography may cause mild discomfort or pressure for a few seconds, as the breast is compressed between two plates to obtain a clear image. However, the procedure is quick, safe, and well tolerated by most women.

Key benefits

  • Detects cancer at very early stages.
  • Improves cure rates.
  • Allows preservation of breast tissue in many cases.
  • Increases therapeutic options and reduces the need for aggressive treatments.

masculino-prueba-de-sangre-blood-test-cb.title: Male Blood Test (CBC, CMP, Lipid Panel, HbA1c, Thyroid, Urinalysis)
masculino-prueba-de-sangre-blood-test-cb.description: Complete male health evaluation: organ function, metabolism, cardiovascular risk, and key hormonal levels.
masculino-prueba-de-sangre-blood-test-cb.detail:
This set of tests is designed to comprehensively assess a man's general health. It includes key analyses to detect early problems in vital organs, metabolism, hormonal levels, and cardiovascular risk.

What is analyzed?

  • Complete Blood Count (CBC): Detects anemia, infections, or blood disorders.
  • Comprehensive Metabolic Panel (CMP): Evaluates kidneys, liver, glucose, and electrolytes.
  • Lipid Panel: Reviews total cholesterol, HDL, LDL, and triglycerides.
  • Urine Microalbumin: Detects early kidney damage.
  • Glycated Hemoglobin (HbA1c): Measures the average blood sugar over the past 2-3 months.
  • Urinalysis (UA): Indicates infections, kidney, or metabolic problems.
  • Thyroid hormones (T3, T4, TSH): Evaluate thyroid function.
  • Occult blood in stool: Early detection of digestive bleeding.

What is it for?

It is ideal for routine checkups or chronic disease management, helping to prevent complications and maintain good overall health.

prueba-de-covid-19-ant-geno-2.title: COVID-19 Antigen Test
prueba-de-covid-19-ant-geno-2.description: Rapid detection of SARS-CoV-2 protein antigens (15-30 mins) for cases with symptoms or recent exposure.
prueba-de-covid-19-ant-geno-2.detail:
The COVID-19 Antigen Test is a rapid test that detects the presence of specific proteins of the SARS-CoV-2 virus (the virus that causes COVID-19) in your body. Unlike the PCR test, which looks for the genetic material of the virus, the antigen test directly identifies virus proteins, making it faster, though sometimes less sensitive.
What is it used for?
  • Rapid detection of COVID-19: The test can detect active COVID-19 infections, especially if you have symptoms such as fever, cough, or difficulty breathing.
  • Fast results: This test provides results in minutes, making it ideal for situations requiring an immediate response, such as health centers or mass events.
  • Screening for possible COVID-19 cases: Used mainly to detect COVID-19 infections in people with symptoms or those who have been exposed to the virus.
When is it recommended?
  • If you have COVID-19 symptoms and need a quick diagnosis.
  • If you have been in close contact with someone diagnosed with COVID-19 and need to know if you are infected.
  • For rapid testing in places like airports, events, or health centers where immediate results are necessary.
How is it done?
The test is performed via a nasal or throat swab. It is a quick procedure, generally painless, and results are available within minutes.

prueba-de-covid-19-molecular-pcr-3.title: COVID-19 Molecular PCR Test
prueba-de-covid-19-molecular-pcr-3.description: The most accurate test to confirm COVID-19 infection, detecting viral genetic material in early stages.
prueba-de-covid-19-molecular-pcr-3.detail:
The COVID-19 Molecular PCR test is one of the most reliable methods to detect if you are infected with the SARS-CoV-2 virus, which causes COVID-19. It uses a technique called Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) to identify the presence of the virus's genetic material in your body, even when you have no symptoms.
What is it used for?
  • Accurate detection of COVID-19: This test can detect infection at early stages, even before symptoms appear, and is very reliable for confirming whether you have COVID-19.
  • Isolation or treatment evaluation: Helps confirm a diagnosis and make decisions about isolation, treatment, or preventive measures.
  • Safety for travel and events: Commonly required for international travel, events, or re-entry into workplaces or educational facilities.
When is it recommended?
  • If you present COVID-19 symptoms, such as fever, cough, difficulty breathing, sore throat, or loss of taste or smell.
  • If you have been in close contact with someone who tested positive for COVID-19.
  • If you need a negative COVID-19 certificate for travel, work, or attending events.
  • If you were exposed to a possible source of contagion.
How is it done?
The test is performed via a nasal or throat swab, taking a sample from your nose or throat. It is a quick and simple procedure, and results are generally available within a short period of time, depending on the laboratory.

prueba-de-covid-19-serolgica-rapid-test-.title: COVID-19 Serological Rapid Test
prueba-de-covid-19-serolgica-rapid-test-.description: Detects antibodies indicating past exposure to the virus or vaccine response. Results available in minutes.
prueba-de-covid-19-serolgica-rapid-test-.detail:
The COVID-19 Serological Rapid Test detects whether your body has developed antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus, responsible for COVID-19. Antibodies are proteins the immune system produces after being exposed to the virus, either through a past infection or a vaccine.
What is it used for?
  • Detection of past exposure to the virus: This test shows whether you have been infected with the virus in the past, even if you did not experience severe symptoms or have already recovered.
  • Immunity assessment: Can help determine whether you have developed antibodies after infection or after receiving a COVID-19 vaccine.
  • Fast results: The test provides results in just a few minutes, allowing a quick response about your immune status.
When is it recommended?
  • If you think you may have been exposed to COVID-19 and want to know if your body has produced antibodies.
  • If you need a quick assessment of your possible immunity after being infected or vaccinated.
  • If you are interested in knowing whether you have had a COVID-19 infection, even if you had no symptoms.
How is it done?
The test involves taking a small blood sample, usually via a finger prick. It is a quick and simple procedure, and results are available within minutes.

prueba-de-embarazo-15.title: Pregnancy Test
prueba-de-embarazo-15.description: hCG hormone detection in urine or blood to confirm pregnancy and begin appropriate prenatal care.
prueba-de-embarazo-15.detail:
The pregnancy test is a diagnostic procedure used to determine the presence of pregnancy by detecting human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG), a substance that begins to be produced after the fertilized egg implants in the uterus. This hormone is specific to pregnancy and its detection allows confirmation of pregnancy at very early stages.

There are two main types of tests:

  1. Urine pregnancy test: The most common and accessible form. Can be performed at home or in a health center. Uses reactive strips that detect hCG in urine, with results generally available within minutes. It is recommended to perform it with the first morning urine for greater accuracy.

  2. Blood pregnancy test: Performed in a clinical laboratory and can be qualitative (confirms whether or not there is a pregnancy) or quantitative (measures the exact concentration of hCG in blood). It is more sensitive than the urine test and can detect pregnancy even before a missed period.

The pregnancy test is useful not only to confirm the pregnancy, but also to monitor its early progress or rule out ectopic or nonviable pregnancies when performed in combination with clinical evaluations and ultrasounds.

This test should be interpreted within the clinical context of each patient, especially when there are menstrual irregularities, gynecological symptoms, use of contraceptives, or fertility history.

prueba-de-influenza-a-y-b-14.title: Influenza A & B Test
prueba-de-influenza-a-y-b-14.description: Rapid detection of type A or B flu viruses to start appropriate treatment and prevent contagion.
prueba-de-influenza-a-y-b-14.detail:
The Influenza A and B Test is a rapid analysis that detects the presence of type A and B flu viruses, which are responsible for the majority of seasonal influenza cases. This test is useful to confirm whether your symptoms are related to the flu or another respiratory infection.
What is it used for?
  • Quick diagnosis: Helps confirm whether symptoms (such as fever, cough, muscle pain, and fatigue) are caused by the flu.
  • Appropriate treatment: Identifying influenza allows doctors to prescribe the right treatment, especially when detected early.
  • Outbreak control: Helps identify the circulation of viruses in the community and take measures to prevent their spread.
When is it recommended?
  • If you have flu symptoms such as fever, cough, sore throat, muscle aches, or fatigue.
  • If you have been in contact with someone diagnosed with influenza.
  • For people at risk of flu complications, such as children, elderly adults, or those with chronic illnesses.
How is it done?
The test is performed with a sample taken from your nose or throat via a swab. It is a quick and safe test whose results are usually available in a short time.

prueba-de-micoplasma-o-bronchitis-12.title: Mycoplasma or Bronchitis Test
prueba-de-micoplasma-o-bronchitis-12.description: Specific blood test to detect respiratory infections caused by Mycoplasma or acute bronchitis.
prueba-de-micoplasma-o-bronchitis-12.detail: Blood test to detect Mycoplasma or bronchitis infections. Results timing depends on the laboratory.

prueba-de-sangre-pth-13.title: PTH Blood Test
prueba-de-sangre-pth-13.description: Measurement of parathyroid hormone to evaluate calcium and phosphorus regulation and detect bone issues.
prueba-de-sangre-pth-13.detail:
The PTH blood test measures the levels of the parathyroid hormone in the blood. PTH, produced by the parathyroid glands, helps regulate calcium in the body by promoting its release from bones, its absorption in the intestines, and its reabsorption in the kidneys. This test is used to evaluate parathyroid gland function and diagnose issues related to calcium metabolism, such as hyperparathyroidism and hypoparathyroidism.
What is PTH?
PTH (parathyroid hormone) is a hormone produced by the parathyroid glands, small glands located in the neck.
What does PTH do?
PTH plays a crucial role in calcium metabolism. It helps to:
  • Release calcium from bones when blood calcium levels are low.
  • Facilitate the absorption of calcium from food in the intestines.
  • Reabsorb calcium in the kidneys, preventing it from being excreted in urine.
Why is the PTH test performed?
  • To evaluate the function of the parathyroid glands.
  • To diagnose and monitor disorders such as hyperparathyroidism (high PTH levels) and hypoparathyroidism (low PTH levels).
  • To identify and evaluate calcium metabolism problems.
What do the PTH test results mean?
High PTH levels may indicate hyperparathyroidism, which can lead to elevated calcium levels in the blood and affect bone and kidney health.
Low PTH levels may indicate hypoparathyroidism, which can cause low blood calcium levels and symptoms such as muscle cramps.

prueba-de-sedimento-esr-11.title: Sedimentation Rate (ESR) Test
prueba-de-sedimento-esr-11.description: Sensitive marker of general body inflammation caused by infections or chronic diseases.
prueba-de-sedimento-esr-11.detail:
The sedimentation test, also known as erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR), is a laboratory test that measures the rate at which red blood cells (erythrocytes) settle to the bottom of a vertical test tube of anticoagulated blood over one hour. This test is not specific to any particular disease, but it is a sensitive marker of general inflammation in the body.

The test is based on the principle that, under normal conditions, red blood cells settle slowly. However, in the presence of inflammatory, infectious, autoimmune, or neoplastic processes, certain plasma proteins ‚Äî such as fibrinogen and globulins ‚Äî increase, causing erythrocytes to clump together and settle more rapidly.

An elevated ESR may indicate active inflammation, but does not provide information about its location or specific cause. Therefore, it is mainly used as a complementary test for the diagnosis or monitoring of diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus, chronic infections, vasculitis, certain cancers, and prolonged infectious processes.

It is also used to monitor response to treatment in inflammatory or autoimmune diseases, observing whether sedimentation levels decrease over time. Factors such as age, sex, pregnancy, or anemia can influence normal ESR values, so interpretation should be done in the patient's clinical context and alongside other tests.

prueba-diabetes-hba1c-41.title: DIABETES Test (HbA1c%)
prueba-diabetes-hba1c-41.description: Average blood sugar levels for the last 2-3 months. Essential for diabetes diagnosis and treatment control.
prueba-diabetes-hba1c-41.detail:
The HbA1c test, also known as glycated hemoglobin, is a key tool in the diagnosis and monitoring of diabetes.
Unlike a fasting glucose test that provides a snapshot, HbA1c provides a view of the average blood glucose levels over the past two to three months.
This feature makes it a reliable test to evaluate long-term glycemic control.

What is this test used for?

The HbA1c fulfills several important clinical purposes:

  • It allows for the diagnosis of type 2 diabetes and prediabetes, especially in people with risk factors but without apparent symptoms.

  • It is essential for the monitoring of patients diagnosed with diabetes, as it allows evaluation of treatment effectiveness, detection of decompensations, and adjustment of medications when necessary.

  • It also functions as a prevention tool, detecting mild glucose elevations that could indicate a future risk of developing diabetes, enabling early interventions.

When is it indicated?

This test is recommended if you present symptoms such as:

  • Excessive thirst

  • Blurry vision

  • Unexplained fatigue

  • Increased urinary frequency

It is also indicated if you have a family history of diabetes, overweight, high blood pressure, or elevated cholesterol.
In adults over 45, it is advisable to include it as part of regular medical checkups, even without symptoms, due to increased risk with age.

How is it done?

The test is simple, quick, and requires no fasting.
Only a blood sample drawn from a vein in the arm is needed.
Results are usually available within a few hours or the next day, expressed as a percentage:

  • Below 5.7%: Normal

  • Between 5.7% and 6.4%: Prediabetes

  • 6.5% or above: Diabetes

quantitative-hcg-test-35.title: Quantitative hCG Test
quantitative-hcg-test-35.description: Exact measurement of pregnancy hormone levels in blood to monitor early gestational development.
quantitative-hcg-test-35.detail:
Quantitative hCG Test

The quantitative hCG test measures the exact amount of human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG) hormone in your blood.
Unlike the standard pregnancy test, which only detects the presence of this hormone, this test precisely measures hCG levels to provide more information about the pregnancy.

What is it used for?

  • Confirm a pregnancy: Detects pregnancy early and can indicate how far along it is.

  • Monitor the pregnancy: Helps doctors evaluate early pregnancy development and verify that hCG levels are increasing appropriately.

  • Detect problems: An abnormal increase or low hCG levels can help detect possible complications such as an ectopic pregnancy or a miscarriage.

When is it recommended?

  • If you have had a positive pregnancy test and want to confirm or monitor progress.

  • If an ectopic pregnancy or problems in the early stages of pregnancy are suspected.

  • To verify the status of pregnancy in women with a history of complications.

How is it done?

It is a simple blood test performed at the clinic or laboratory.
No prior preparation is needed, and results are generally available within a few hours.

sonomamografia-28.title: Sono-mammography
sonomamografia-28.description: Painless breast ultrasound to complement mammography, ideal for evaluating cysts or dense breast tissue.
sonomamografia-28.detail:
Sono-mammography, also known as breast ultrasound, is a diagnostic imaging examination that uses high-frequency sound waves to evaluate the internal structure of breast tissue. This non-invasive and radiation-free procedure allows real-time visualization of breast characteristics, being especially useful as a complement to conventional mammography, or as the primary study in young women, those with dense breasts, or pregnant women, in whom mammography may have lower sensitivity.

The main goal of sono-mammography is to detect, characterize, and differentiate palpable or non-palpable masses or alterations in the breast, such as cysts, fibroadenomas, solid nodules, or suspicious lesions. It is also used to guide interventional procedures such as fine or core needle biopsies, and to evaluate axillary lymph nodes, abscess drainage, or post-surgical monitoring.

During the exam, the specialist applies a conductive gel on the breast skin and slides a transducer that emits sound waves, which bounce back from the tissues and generate detailed images on a monitor. The procedure is painless, quick (15-30 minutes), and safe for all types of patients.

Sono-mammography is essential in the screening and follow-up of benign and malignant breast diseases, and plays a key role in the early detection of breast cancer, enabling a more accurate diagnosis and timely therapeutic planning.

strep-throat-garganta-44.title: Strep Throat Test (Throat)
strep-throat-garganta-44.description: Rapid test that detects streptococcus bacteria in minutes to differentiate bacterial from viral infections.
strep-throat-garganta-44.detail:
What is the Strep Throat Rapid Test?

The rapid streptococcal detection test (RADT) is a diagnostic test designed to detect the presence of Streptococcus pyogenes (Group A streptococcus), a bacterium that causes streptococcal pharyngitis, a common throat infection.

What is it used for?

It is used to:

  • Confirm whether a sore throat is caused by a bacterial infection (streptococcus) and not a virus.

  • Determine whether antibiotic treatment is required.

  • Reduce the unnecessary use of antibiotics in viral infections.

How is it done?

  • A healthcare professional uses a sterile swab to rub the back of the throat and tonsils.

  • The swab is inserted into a chemical reagent or cartridge that identifies proteins (antigens) of Group A streptococcus.

  • The result is available within 5 to 10 minutes.

Test accuracy

  • Sensitivity: 70-90% (false negatives are possible).

  • Specificity: >95% (false positives are rare).

  • If the result is negative but there is high clinical suspicion, a throat culture is recommended, which is more accurate but takes 24-48 hours.

Interpreting results

  • Positive: Streptococcal infection confirmed. An antibiotic such as penicillin or amoxicillin is generally prescribed.

  • Negative: The cause is likely viral. In some cases a throat culture is ordered if symptoms are significant.

Typical Strep Throat symptoms

  • Sudden sore throat

  • Fever

  • Swollen or pus-covered tonsils

  • Pain when swallowing

  • Swollen lymph nodes in the neck

  • Absence of cough (suggests bacterial origin)

panel-respiratorio-covid-19-molecular-in.title: Respiratory Panel: COVID-19 PCR, Influenza A/B, and Mycoplasma
panel-respiratorio-covid-19-molecular-in.description: Combined detection of the most common causes of respiratory symptoms in a single rapid and accurate analysis.
panel-respiratorio-covid-19-molecular-in.detail:
Combined Respiratory Infection Test

This combined test allows detection of several common respiratory infections in a fast and accurate manner, all in a single analysis. It includes tests for:

1. COVID-19 Molecular (PCR)

Detects the presence of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, which causes COVID-19, through a molecular (PCR) test.
It is the most reliable method to identify the virus, even in the early stages of infection, before symptoms appear.

2. Influenza A and B

Identifies the viruses responsible for seasonal flu, types A and B, which can cause symptoms similar to COVID-19, such as fever, cough, and muscle pain.

3. Mycoplasma

Detects the bacterium Mycoplasma pneumoniae, a common cause of respiratory infections such as bronchitis and atypical pneumonia.

What is it used for?

  • Quick and accurate diagnosis: Determines whether you are infected by any of these pathogens and starts the appropriate treatment.

  • Differentiation of respiratory diseases: Distinguishes between COVID-19, influenza, and Mycoplasma, which share similar symptoms, avoiding unnecessary treatments.

  • Public health control: Helps prevent contagion and make informed decisions about isolation, care, and medical follow-up.

When is it recommended?

  • If you present respiratory symptoms such as fever, cough, difficulty breathing, sore throat, or fatigue.

  • If you have had contact with a person diagnosed with COVID-19 or influenza.

  • If you have a history of recurrent respiratory infections or suspect Mycoplasma.

How is it done?

The test is performed with a sample taken from the nose or throat via a swab.
It is a quick, safe, and minimally invasive procedure.
Results are usually available within a few hours, allowing you to act quickly on your health.

producto-de-prueba-paquete-64.title: System Test Package
producto-de-prueba-paquete-64.description: Verification service used for system validation.

pruebas-para-licencia-matrimonial-32.title: Marriage License Tests
pruebas-para-licencia-matrimonial-32.description: Fulfills legal requirements for marriage. Includes STD labs, blood typing, and official certification.
pruebas-para-licencia-matrimonial-32.detail:
Meet health requirements for marriage without complications

If you are getting married, authorities or the civil registry may require medical tests as part of the process. We offer a complete and reliable marriage license testing service, with fast results and valid certificates ready to present.

What does the service include?

  • Required medical tests according to your country or region's standards (such as blood tests, STD tests, blood type, among others)
  • Evaluation by a healthcare professional
  • Signed and stamped medical certificate ready for the civil registry
  • Digital or printed delivery as needed

Why are these tests required?

  • To ensure both parties are aware of their health status
  • To prevent disease and protect the couple and future family
  • It is a legal requirement in many countries for civil marriage

Why choose us?

  • Fast, safe, and confidential service
  • Legally valid certificates
  • Qualified and professional medical staff
  • Results in the shortest possible time

test-de-enfermedades-de-transmisin-sexua.title: STD Panel
test-de-enfermedades-de-transmisin-sexua.description: Comprehensive panel to detect HIV, syphilis, chlamydia, and gonorrhea. Vital for preventive sexual health.
test-de-enfermedades-de-transmisin-sexua.detail:
It is a set of tests performed to detect various sexually transmitted diseases (STDs), such as gonorrhea, chlamydia, syphilis, herpes, HIV, hepatitis B and C, among others.
These tests are essential for maintaining your sexual health and that of your partners, and are an effective way to detect infections that do not always present symptoms.

What is it used for?

  • Early detection: Helps identify sexually transmitted infections (STIs) before they become serious health problems.

  • Prevention: Detecting and treating infections early prevents complications and their spread.

  • Control and monitoring: If you have already been diagnosed with an STI, this panel helps monitor the progress of your treatment.

When is it recommended?

  • If you have had unprotected sex or with multiple partners.

  • If you have symptoms such as abnormal discharge, pain when urinating, ulcers, or genital lesions.

  • As part of a routine sexual health checkup, even if you have no symptoms.

  • If you are planning a pregnancy or are in a stable relationship and want to confirm you have no infections.

How is it done?

This panel includes several tests that may require blood, urine, or swab samples.
It is a simple, quick, and confidential procedure.
Results are generally delivered in a short period of time.

programa-de-reduccin-de-peso-58.title: Weight Reduction Program
programa-de-reduccin-de-peso-58.description: Complete service including initial medical appointment, required lab tests, and prescription to pharmacy.
programa-de-reduccin-de-peso-58.detail: Medical appointment, lab tests, and prescription to pharmacy.
